data.Name: Dana Scott Gilmore
data.staff_bio:
Mr. Dana Gilmore has been involved with research in many capacities at the ICI dating back to 1992, when he started as a statistics consultant. His primary research focus has been studying employment services for people with developmental disabilities. Dana has been involved in many projects, including data collection from state Mental Retardation/Developmental Disabilities agencies, surveys to direct providers about their employment services, and secondary analysis of data from many state agencies and the Rehabilitation Services Administration. He is also part of ICI's Rehabilitation Research and Training Center on State Systems and Employment, where he works on a large state systems survey and the state profiles web page. Dana also provides help with data analysis on many other ICI projects.

Dana has worked as a data consultant for the state of Connecticut's Vocational Rehabilitation agency and for the Organisation for Economic Co-Operation and Development. His academic background consists of a B.A. in math and economics from Boston University and a M.A. in economics from American University.
data.staff_ed:
B.A., Boston University
M.A., American University
